definition: the destruction of an enemy plane or ship or tank or missile, end or extinguish by forceful means
details:
noun
- the destruction of an enemy plane or ship or tank or missile
= example: the destruction of an enemy plane or ship or tank or missile
- the act of terminating a life
= synonyms: putting to death, killing
verb
- end or extinguish by forceful means
= synonyms: stamp out
- destroy a vitally essential quality of or in
= example: destroy a vitally essential quality of or in
- cause to cease operating
= example: cause to cease operating
- tire out completely
= example: tire out completely
- mark for deletion, rub off, or erase
= example: mark for deletion, rub off, or erase
= synonyms: obliterate
- drink down entirely
= synonyms: down, pop, bolt down, toss off, belt down, pour down, drink down
- cause to die
- cause the death of, without intention
= example: cause the death of, without intention
- deprive of life
= example: deprive of life
- hit with great force
= example: hit with great force
- hit with so much force as to make a return impossible, in racket games
= example: hit with so much force as to make a return impossible, in racket games
- overwhelm with hilarity, pleasure, or admiration
= example: overwhelm with hilarity, pleasure, or admiration
- be the source of great pain for
= example: be the source of great pain for
- thwart the passage of
= example: thwart the passage of
= synonyms: defeat, shoot down, vote down
- be fatal
= example: be fatal
